notes: The Saab 9-3 sits on the GM Epsilon platform. Brake rotors, pads, and even calipers often interchange with the Chevy Malibu and Pontiac G6. The 'Aero' brakes are larger (314mm) and are a cheap upgrade for base model Malibus/G6s.

compatibleVehicles: Ford Contour / Mercury Mystique (Earlier platform cousins)
notes: The Jaguar X-Type is famously based on the Ford Mondeo platform. Control arms, struts, and many suspension bushings are identical to the Ford Mondeo. You can buy 'Ford' parts for a fraction of the 'Jaguar' price.

partName: Aston Martin Key Fob / Volvo Key
notes: The expensive Aston Martin 'Crystal Key' (ECU) is internally a Volvo key fob. If you peel back the leather on a standard Aston plastic key, it says Volvo. You can program a Volvo key to work with an Aston Martin (though it won't look as fancy).

partName: Mini Cooper (R50/R53) / Chrysler Neon Engine Parts
notes: The 1st Gen Mini used the 'Tritec' engine, a joint venture between Chrysler and Rover. Some internal parts and sensors are shared with Chrysler Neons (specifically export models). The supercharged R53 engine is unique, but the block architecture is shared.
Lamborghini famously licensed the headlights from the Nissan 300ZX (Z32) for the facelifted Diablo. They even have the Nissan logo on the top edge (covered by a carbon fiber strip on the Lambo).
